nodes.title: Article 12
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the principles for setting tariffs for universal service provisions. The main points are that prices must be affordable, cost-oriented, transparent, non-discriminatory, and geographically uniform. They must also account for any state compensation. Additionally, it allows for individual tariff agreements based on the volume and nature of services provided.

nodes.title: Article 4
nodes.summary: This partial document defines key terms and concepts related to postal services in a regulatory context. The main points covered are the official definitions of entities such as the Minister, the Regulatory Authority, and different types of postal operators (public and authorized). It also defines core postal services, including the "universal postal service" and "basic postal service," specifying weight limits and item types. Finally, it defines related operational concepts like "transport," "postal network," and "postal item." The section serves as a glossary for the subsequent regulatory text.
